These likely result to a wide variance in output quality and total number of printed pages that is surely a far cry from the rating of its OEM counterpart. Bleeding cartridges or cartridge items that leak toner powder into the printer's internal mechanisms are typical symptoms of substandard quality replacement cartridges.
;
;Keep in mind that toner powder filling the cartridges are composed of fine particles measure 3 microns across within diameter. Therefore, when the build quality of a compatible toner cartridge declines below accepted standards, it is likely for the unit to cause undue trouble for the laser printer. As an example, the physical configuration on the cartridge's moving parts is set using a computer-aided alignment system. Alignment is critical since tolerance between surfaces that exceed 1/10, 000 of an inch will surely lead to the leak of toner powder into the cartridge.
;
;Note that accurate alignment may be assured only by using sophisticated equipment to footwear. Since a leaking toner cartridge can ultimately damage the printer, it becomes mandatory for epson CX11 printer users to consider a compatible toner cartridge manufacturer that will guarantee encompassing reliability.
;
;Not surprisingly, users need not buy OEM replacement cartridges all the time just to be assured in the consumable's build quality. Getting an OEM replacement everytime the cartridge runs dry of toner supply may be such a burden to help regular laser printer users because of pricing and funds considerations. The aftermarket can supply Epson CX11 users with good quality Epson S050187 (yellow), S050188 (magenta), S050189 (cyan) together with S050190 (black) compatible toner cartridges for a fraction of the cost of OEM replacement cartridges. OEM Epson cartridges are sold at $120 a item while compatibles currently retail from between $30 to $34 per cartridge unit. The mentioned Epson compatible cartridges can also be used on the Epson C1100 Aculaser lazer printer.
;.

As it functions liquid ink, it is often impede to dry and may take some time to print full color pages.
;
;Due to its limitations, the inkjet is frequently used as a personal printer. It is ideal for infrequent use or producing high quality images. They have come on quite some distance and speeds are regularly improving, so certainly not worth writing off.
;
;However, if you are looking to do major printing jobs or have a number of workstations accessing the unit, a laser printer may be the better option. Rather than using liquid ink, which can be smudged and slows the printing process consequently, laser printers use a special dry powder solution. It's applied to the page while using the laser, which creates an image based on a magnetically produced blueprint. Complicated stuff, nevertheless it does work.
;
;Laser machines can produce full color pages in around two seconds (normally). Despite the higher speed, there is little or no possibility of your finished page that contains smudges or smears as a result of the ink. The ongoing costs is going to be lower than an inkjet and will also be able to produce huge volumes of printed pages in no time at all.
;
;However, if you are looking for a cost-effective printer with high output quality for low volume offices or your property, an inkjet or even gelsprint colour printer may provide a better solution. They tend to are more compact, cheaper to buy and run for smaller print loads and are straightforward to maintain.
